result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen Mario McLevain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: JOC Amended: 07-12-2016 Judge Wagner-Court stays HOC time as to Count 1 and sets restitution at zero.

Defendant Allen Mario McLevain in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  alex mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The state has not been provided any restitution information and the victim does not appear.  The court sets restitution at zero.  The court will stay the House of Correction time as to count 1.
Cash bail on deposit to be applied to all financial obligations imposed at sentencing on 3-23-2016.  Any remaining balance to be returned to surety.

Defendant Allen Mario McLevain in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Alex Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
State advises the court that they do not have any additional information regarding restitution. Court orders restitution at zero. 
Court advises the parties the the review hearing scheduled for 6/20/2016 must be rescheduled due to court being down. Clerk emailed defense attorney and provided new date. Case calendared for Review Hearing on 7/12/2016 at 8:15 a.m. in Branch 38.  Review hearing scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.

As to each of the counts:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgments of conviction entered.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by counsels and defendant.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, each count consecutive; credit for 45 days served as to count 1.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS, concurrent with the following conditions:
-AS TO COUNT 1:  Serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction STAYED for review on 6-20-2016..
-Follow all rules of probation.
-No further violations of the law.
--Maintain employment.
-Counseling needs to be determined.
-AS TO COUNT 2:  Perform 30 HOURS of community service at a non-profit agency.
-Pay victim witness surcharge and all costs, assessments and surcharges.
-Provide DNA sample and pay costs.
Failure to pay all costs will result in entry of civil judgment.
Defendant will not stipulate to restitution without proof provided.  Case is adjourned to 5-12-2016 for restitution hearing and 6-20-2016 for review of stayed HOC.
Defense counsel to advise of appeal rights.  Pretrial credit sheet filed.

Defendant Allen Mario McLevain in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter set for jury trial today but a resolution as been reached.
Amended Information filed by the state charging 2 counts of BATTERY, class A misdemeanors, 940.19(1)  Restitution hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Review hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 08:51 am.
Filed by the state:  Witness List; Motion in Limine; Jury Instructions
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Allen Mario McLevain in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The court is informed that the defendant is now reconsidering resolving this matter short of trial.  Trial date of 3-23-2016 to stand.

Defendant Allen Mario McLevain in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised that there has been a global offer to resolve with another pending matter 15CF5151 from Branch 7.  Branch 38 will accept that case. Case is adjourned to 3-15-2016 at 8:15; other case to be transferred.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.

16RM008064  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02/10/2016

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Allen Mario McLevain not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has pending matter in Branch 7.    Case set for final pretrial on 3-7-2016 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 3-23-2016 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Allen Mario McLevain in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Allen Mario McLevain in custody.  Alyssa Schaller for Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38 as of February 1, 2016 due to Judicial Rotation.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Allen Mario McLevain in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Allen Mario McLevain in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for return on warrant. Discussion regarding the defendant's non-appearance at the last court date. Defendant has a new pending case 15CF5151. Arguments heard as to bail. Court ordered cash bail set at $1,000.00 with turnover to Justice Point monitoring. Defendant to have no contact with anyone listed on the no contact order. This matter needs to be returned to preliminary court. Case adjourned to Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 1/07/16. ADA Mueller notified. Defendant did not qualify for public defender representation previously. PD's office notified to conduct another evaluation. Case adjourned to 1/13/16 at 8:30 a.m. for return on warrant in Branch 25. 
Bench warrant in file.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($1000.00) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court.  James Frisch for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Preliminary hearing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Allen Mario McLevain in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for indigency hearing. Defendant now qualifies for public defender representation. This matter needs to be sent back to prelim court. Case adjourned to Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter from the Public Defender's Office received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Memorandum from the Office of the State Public Defender received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Allen Mario McLevain in court.  Kimberly Schepp for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears without counsel.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing on September 3 at 8:30 a.m., Branch 25.  Indigency hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with C.Z., M.M., M.C. and A.P.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Allen Mario McLevain in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Allen Mario McLevain not in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.vb
